text:
is there a "native" way for me to splat all the values of the parameters of a struct? So:
```struct A
    x
    y
    z
end
a = A(1,2,3)
a...
(1,2,3)```
or a vector `[1,2,3]`

elements.text: is there a "native" way for me to splat all the values of the parameters of a struct? So:

struct A
    x
    y
    z
end
a = A(1,2,3)
a...
(1,2,3)

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

Success, it has been cross posted <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/56951| to Discourse>. Keep and eye out on Discourse for responses and please add an answer there once you are satisfied with the solution so others can benefit as well. Happy debugging!
I believe struct destructuring like `(; a, b) = x` is coming in 1.7(?). Not quite what you wanted, though.
